conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Nefaria and Nadine's adventurer stories, and for the ＂Sands of Revelation＂ event.
Answer for true, Nadine: You claim these vestments suit me, but I'll not be swayed by idle cajolery.
Your style of dress is quite...individual. And though its purpose be disguise, I cannot think it flatters me.
Girl, you look adorbs. Total knockout!
Descendant of Nefaria's Kingdom Nadine
Oh, wait! Lemme get a snap! I gotta document girl time with my pal for posterity. It's, like, a law or whatever.
Only in that strange land inside your mind.
Wait, so you're okay with the pal bit?
Nrgh?! W-well, I see no sense in disputing what is sooth.
Aw, look at us getting all close! *sniff* Oh man, I'm having a moment here...
I'm so fired up thinking about our big date after this! We're gonna go OFF, girl!
Let us ensure we ＂go off＂ in moderation.
No way—you gotta go full bananapants at a festival! I mean, it's the dunefolk descended from your Sandreach peeps who are putting it on and stuff!
Heck, maybe you'll even remember something there!
Mistake me not: I appreciate the thought. But that is no cause for intemperance.
I must ensure I keep interactions with my subjects' descendants to a minimum, lest my true identity be discovered.
I'll not permit terror at the risen dead to ruin such an occasion.
I feel like they'd be chill, though— or maybe even low-key stoked?
I mean, when I found out you were the queen from those legends, I was like, BAZAMBA, GIRL! That's LEGIT!
Yet your sensibilities are passing curious, Nadine, and not all may share them.
One cannot be overcautious; none must know that I am she.
Now if the matter be settled, let us away. Pray, lead on.
You got it! The settlement's this way!
Oh, crazy! I almost stepped right in that puddle!
Puddles...are crazy...
Whoaaa, check that beautiful sunset! Crazy!
Sunsets...also crazy...?
Uh, Ria? Why are you writing down everything I'm saying or whatever?
If I am to mimic your mode of speech, I must first learn it.
You wanna copy how I talk?
Just so. The idea was yours, was it not?
You claimed my speech was ＂all fancy- pants,＂ and bade me change it that it might aid with my disguise.
Oh yeah. I DID say that, huh? Hee hee! Totally spaced on that bit. Aside from the whole amnesia thing, you've got a totally crazy memory, Ria!
There. That.
Where? What?
This talk of ＂crazy.＂ I know it as a word to describe situations that are highly chaotic.
Yet you use it willy-nilly to describe both good and bad, foul and fair. So which is the proper meaning?
Both! Crazy is crazy, you know? You just gotta get a vibe check to know.
Both?! Then how, pray, might one discern one meaning from its opposite? How does one perform this ＂vibe check＂?
I dunno. You just sorta...read the feeling?
So a vibe is akin to a feeling? Aye, I can make some sense of that, at least.
So then, you claim that ＂crazy＂ may be used to mean worthy or ill based purely on one's whim and caprice?
Not a hundred percent about all those words, but I think so, yeah. I mean, crazy's an easy go-to for any occasion.
I guess if you wanna talk like me, just toss crazy around a lot!
Surely there must be some limit to its use.
Yeah, maaaybe? I dunno. I just use it when I feel it.
Just go with the flow!
It seems utter madness to say such, but I suppose it makes a kind of...sense?
A phantasmagoric word able to change its hue to match any context is truly...crazy?
Preach, girl! You're gonna be chatting away like your BFF Nadine in no time.
So! Now that you've mastered the fine art of speaking Nadinese...
Let's kick off this date at the dunefolk settlement! The festival's gonna be lit!
The duo's arrival at the dunefolk settlement is marked by a pair of unexpected events.
One is an imperial attack. The other...
Stomp it out down the runway, then VOGUE! Boom!
B-boom.
That was perfect, Ria. Totes nasty!
...The other is a fashion show held at the dunefolk festival—an event in which both Nadine and Nefaria have been asked to participate.
Seriously, you're slaying it. I've got nothing left to teach you.
I am gladdened to hear it, and pray only that my performance might entertain the audience.
The scions of the Sandreach are forsooth a people most stout-hearted; even an armed incursion has not dulled their enthusiasm.
I will do all in my power to reward such perseverance.
Oh, for sure. I can't wait to hit the runway with you, girl! It's gonna be great!
Oh, and speaking of things I can't wait for, I totally blanked that we had a date to go check out the festival!
We gotta get on that. Let's go, Ria!
Fie, Nadine! You needn't tear my arm from my body!
Ooo, I like the smell of what's cookin'... Check out all the food stalls!
I totally don't even know where to start. What're you thinkin', girl?
I need nothing more. I am sated.
Say whaaat? We haven't eaten yet!
'Tis my breast that is full to bursting, not my stomach.
The scions of the kingdom I lost live on, embracing life and all its myriad joys.
This sight alone leaves my heart replete.
Ohmigosh, I'm totally gonna bawl. That was SO sweet!
But seriously, we need to eat something.
Heck, maybe some familiar flavors will spark a memory or three, yeah?
Aye, perhaps so.
Marry, what a tantalizing aroma!
Wh-what is this sensation?! Nostalgia's pangs mingle with a burgeoning hunger that wells up from the core of my being!
*sniff* *sniiiiff* Oh yeah, it's def those kebabs at the stall over there.
They say the flavor all comes down to a secret spice blend that's been passed down through the generations!
Then there might be a chance I tasted such meat myself long ago and longer still!
See? What'd I tell you? The head might forget, but the gut ALWAYS remembers.
We gotta try a bite so you can find out for sure!
*drool* Y-you make a compelling case... Let us indulge ourselves, then.
NOW it's starting to feel like a festival!
*munch* *chomp* *munch* Zounds! Such rich and nuanced flavor!
Yeah, I can't even right now.
...So? You remembering anything?
Alas, no.
Aw, boo. Guess the only thing this brought back to you was an appetite.
B-but surely 'tis too soon to acquiesce! Another delicacy may yet yield results!
Hey, it's worth a shot! Leave it to me— I got the hot tips on the tastiest treats!
Then I shall rely upon your wisdom.
Girl, I am game to stuff my face until we get ALL of your memories back.
Ooof. We did a couple laps of the meat- veg-tea-dessert loop and I am BURSTING!
Bummer it didn't shake loose any of your old memories, but at least we had fun!
Don't you think, Ria? ...Uhh, Ria? Hey, where'd she go?
*sigh*
Ria?! What's wrong, girl?!
'Tis no cause for concern; I am weary, nothing more.
Guess I had us hit the ol' food-stall circuit a little too hard, huh?
You've naught to apologize for. The fault is my own.
Whatcha mean?
In my excitement, I lost all sight of temperance.
Yet you have my gratitude; this has all been a most happy experience.
Aw, Ria...
Alas, this ＂festival date＂ indulgence nears its end, as all good things must.
For to fraternize with the people here any longer poses too great a risk of revealing my true identity.
Okay, then just ooooone more spot. Last one, I promise!
Yet to tempt fortune any further would—
I know! But there's one thing left I just HAVE to show you. Pleeease?
Fie, Nadine... Very well. But only one!
You are. The BEST. Okay, let's go!
What is it you seek to show me?
Hee hee! You'll just have to wait and see. C'mon, it's this way!
Lessee... Last year it was over...here?
Nadine, hold! Those children there...
*sob* Y-you big MEANIE!
Hmph! Go ahead and cry—I'm not sorry!
Looks like a couple siblings are going at it. Probably nothing serious.
(But it's full-on got Ria's attention.)
(And since she's actually down to help, I better step the heck up!)
On it, girl! I'll get 'em sorted.
W-wait! Nadine!
I wonder if she's really the best to handle this...
Hey, squirts. What's with the waterworks?
*sniffle* M-my brother's being mean...
He promised we'd eat kebabs together at the festival, but then he ate ALL of 'em!
Okay, NOT cool, dude.
I think you owe your little sis here an apology, hungry man.
Nuh-uh! I knocked on her door like a BAZILLION times this morning and she never answered, so it's her own fault!
I waited for her until noon! If I waited any longer, the kebabs mighta been gone!
Wait, she stood you up until past noon?! NOT cool, dudette!
Girl, you are mad killing me here. What's your deal?
B-but I... I... WAAAAAAH!
See? I told you it's your own fault!
Okay, let's take it down a few dozen pegs with the blame talk. I'm sure your sister here had her reasons for the ditch.
Work with me, girl. Stop crying for a sec and break it down for us.
WAAAAAAAAAH!
Oh man, big yikes. I feel like I just made things worse.
Um, wait! Kebabs! You missed out, so I'll just buy you a new one!
You can split it with your bro and we'll all call it goo—
Nooo! That's not the point! I don't want it!
Okay, now I'm SUPER lost. Aren't you fighting over kebabs?
I fear the seeds of her melancholy lie elsewhere.
Do you know something here, Ria? 'Cause I am WAY outta my element.
Also, are you sure you wanna do this? I thought you were keeping everything on the down-low and stuff.
Doing naught to ease their strife would sit ill upon my conscience.
I would ask you dry your eyes, child.
WAAAAAAAH!
Calm, little one. You are not at fault here. Now prithee, heed my query.
*sniff* O-okay...
Excellent. Now then, may I assume you looked forward to today's festivities with great anticipation?
Yeah, I was really, really, REALLY excited.
But you did not attend it straight away, instead staying in your bedchamber past midday. Surely you had reason for such?
Yeah, I couldn't decide what to wear. I wanted to look extra pretty 'cause it's a festival, so I... I...
I just wanted to look cute.
HUH?!
Oh, I vibe hard with that—sometimes it takes forevs to put together a power look!
B-but he just left me and went off all by himself!
And you felt sad, which soon gave way to quarrel.
It wasn't the food she really cared about— it was getting to enjoy the festival with her big bro there.
Then why didn't you just SAY so?!
...'Cause I was embarrassed.
Aw, it's... Look, I'm sorry, okay? I should have waited for you.
Well spoken, child. And now that you have treated and come to concord, the two of you may depart and revel in the festival's delights together.
Hee hee! You talk funny.
Urk!
(Fie, Nadine! I completely forgot to mimic your mannerisms!)
(D-don't worry, girl—I don't think these kids have any idea that you're—)
You listened to me and understood why I was sad—just like Queen Nefaria from the legends!
N-nay, child! You are...uh...mad mistaken! I am just, like, a commoner or whatever!
Right? Totes. Anywaygottagobyyye!
Bye bye!
Phew! I can but hope that dispelled their suspicions.
I must confess, I am gobsmacked a babe of her lean years would know my name.
Really? Why? I mean, you're kiiinda...
Kind of what? Speak your mind plain.
Hee hee! You'll see when we get there. Now, let's go—for reals this time!
It should be right over... Oh, noice!
Here we go, Ria. That right there is what I wanted to show you!
Listen close, children, as I spin a tale of the legendary Queen Nefaria!
Fie, these mummers are capering about performing a play of my exploits!
They sure as heck are!
Us dunefolk grow up hearing stories about you! That's how the kids we bumped into knew your name.
Uh, you still with me, girl? You kinda locked up there.
I'm merely a bit...trepidatious of how this retelling might portray me.
I am the last queen of the Sandreach. What if I play not the part of the hero, but the mooncalf who led her kingdom to ruin?
Okay, do you SERIOUSLY think I would haul you out here just so some rando could open the library and read you?
...I suppose not.
Long ago and longer still, centuries before centuries past...
Far to the south, at the vast desert's heart, ancestors of dunefolk like you and me lived in a kingdom called the Sandreach.

Since time immemorial, the Sandreach had been guided by a royal line that wielded powerful magics—and the kindest, strongest, and most beautiful of them all was the last of her line, good Queen Nefaria.
Not before or since has a ruler cared more for her people; her singular purpose was to see that the dunefolk might live happy and free.
When her retainers brought word that her subjects were struggling, she would go to them herself, listen to their worries, and see the issue resolved.
Thus did her people live in peace, secure in the knowledge their beloved queen would ever race to their aid in times of strife.
And that's the end of chapter one, kids. We'll have a brief break, then continue our tale of Queen Nefaria's heroic exploits!
See? You sound like a boss in this story! All the kids are obsessed with you.
Spoiler alert: Basically all us dunefolk love you to bits, Ria.
This is good hearing; I dared not dream my people's line held such love for me.
Dear Nadine, you've my gratitude for bringing me to see such a splendid show. I am powerfully moved.
Aw, I'm just happy you're happy!
...However.
Uh oh. What's up? Did the writer dude get something wrong? I'll give notes!
To hear such unvarnished praise is a ticklish thing. Surely even the most shameless flattery must have limits!
I've vague recollections of leaving the palace to speak with subjects, but these claims of racing to their side...
But you DID talk to them, right? I mean, that's proof enough you cared, 'cause most royal folk just sit in their castle and eat big turkey legs all day or whatever.
And so what if they talked you up a bit to the grandkids? That's just proof of how much they loved you!
Then you would hold this flattery to be born of affection true?
A pretty thought, if it be so. I suppose I ought not spurn it, though it belies the facts.
Gather 'round and listen to the second part of our tale of good Queen Nefaria!
The great queen was more than just a kind ruler: She was also a sorceress of tremendous power!
When seas roiled and the people could not sail, they besought their queen for aid. So wise Nefaria cast a mighty bolt into the depths...
And the vast sea was split in twain, allowing her subjects to load their wares on carts and cross the bare seabed to trade with other lands!

But Nefaria was more than powerful: Her beauty was unmatched in all the world! Her wardrobe teemed with garbs of finest silk, and the sight of her dressed in resplendent finery filled her people with much hope and pride.
Whenever she donned a new dress and danced, all who witnessed her fell instantly in love. Why, even a dragon once begged her hand in marriage!
Kindness, might, and beauty—the legendary queen had all these things and more. And so we sing the praises of Nefaria, pride of the desert sands!
The end.
Yaaaay, good Queen Nefaria! Go ON with your bad self!
I stand transfixed at this story... I haven't even the words at hand!
So you're speechless and stuff?
A mirthless jest, Nadine; I am aghast!
Whaaat?! Wait, why?! I thought we decided a little embellishment was just a sign of love.
All things have their limit, and those tales held nary a whiff of truth. Fie, but each claim was more fanciful than the last!
So they didn't just...you know? Tell a true story with a little extra spice?
Perhaps where spellcraft was concerned; 'tis sooth the royal line e'er possessed magics most potent.
But these claims of my...my BEAUTY are entirely spurious!
This mad prattle of dragons enamored by flashy garb and dancing are naught but the most flagrant of fabrications.
And pray tell, from whence has all this talk of fashion come? I've never expressed one whit of interest in clo...
Hold. Clothing and dance? Clothing and... Marry, why does that sound familiar?!
Ohmigosh, maybe you've got more memories coming back!
Clothing and dance... Donning a new dress...
Ah! I recall it now!
Clothing and dance... Donning a new dress...
Ah! I recall it now!
(There WAS one day each year when I would dress in finery and dance...)
(But it was not in the service of vanity, nor for love of fashion.)
(The festival rite of dance was an act of prostration before the dragon who formed our kingdom—an expression of thanks.)
(I would don the ceremonial robes and offer my dance while all the Sandreach's people joined together in prayer.)
(We were a pious people; no doubt some other rose up to continue this rite in the years after my demise.)
(The tradition survives, warped by time into the fashion show they hold today.)
(Ahh... More memories of that time are returning now to clarity.)
(Yes... It was the final festival before the Sandreach fell to ruin.)
(There in my palace, far removed from the city's joyful clamor, I donned the robes and offered up the rite of dance.)
(Such was the duty of one born to the line of the Sandreach's kings, and never once did I think it a burden.)
(Yet each year, I would complete the rite and gaze upon the city in the distance.)
(I would see the women gather, eager to make merry at the day's revels, and for the briefest of moments know envy.)
(Perhaps that remained my one regret: A selfish dream I could not see realized while in life.)
(Now, centuries on, I find myself revived by fate's ineffable caprice.)
(And that fate selfsame now sees me taking in the festival at Nadine's side.)
(The dream I now recall is come to pass.)
(Mayhap this explains my giddy jubilance, foreign as the sentiment be.)
Well, girl?! Didja remember anything?
Indeed, I have. I know now the truth behind the claim that I donned finery and gamboled about.
But first, I've aught I must impress upon you.
Nadine, you cannot know the gratitude I feel for bringing me hence to this festival.
Okay, where's THIS coming from?
Call it a passing impulse; a fancy.
Cryptic much? But whatever, I won't pry. Heck, I wanted to thank you too, so I guess we'll just call it even!
This festival date was, like, crazy rad. Thanks for the sweet new memories, girl!
I swear I shall never forget this day.
So NOW will you tell me what you remembered?
Hmm... Mayhap such conversation is best had over refreshment and libation. Shall we make for the dining stalls?
Girl, are you serious? You had me at grub! ...Er, you DID say we're going to get some grub right now, yeah?
But wait, are you sure? I thought you wanted to haul buns outta here before anybody peeped your true identity.
I've since recalled just how dearly I longed to enjoy such revels.
'Twould be an unforgivable waste to do any less than enjoy it to the fullest now.
Surely none will be the wiser, provided I mask my speech with care—and why else have I practiced such language?
Now let us hence, that we might score some crazy eats, girl!
Aaah ha ha! You're the BEST, Nefaria!
(I've a friend and equal at my side to share in this joy and laughter... Truly, there is no greater blessing in life.)
(I know not why fate saw fit to retrieve me from the dark, nor how long this second existence may continue...)
(But if fate be kind, I pray these days might continue on forever.)
